intro: Danaea stricta, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture, while its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences. Danaea stricta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, humid environments.
